metadata.synopsis: Reacting to a scroll being thrown into lava and revealing itself as a scroll of true resurrection - one normally obtained by conducting a ritual that summons a mephit to cast lava on the scroll. Here, the player likely figured out a workaround.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Ah, it worked. Who needs mephits when you have a convenient lava pool?
1.context: InternalNodeContext: Players have heard of the protocol but instead just thrown the scroll into lava.NodeContext: figured out a way to bypass a magical procedure to obtain a scroll.

0.speaker: Gale
0.text: Interesting workaround... though not one that can be counted on it all circumstances.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: A scroll of true resurrection? Wasn't expecting that...
2.context: InternalNodeContext: Players haven't heard of the protocol, threw a scroll into lava, and it became a scroll of resurrection.NodeContext: Some surprise (threw a scroll into lava, causing it to change)
